articles.title: Group Race of Officials Marks First Sports Day of Year
articles.content:
Group Race of Officials Marks First Sports Day of Year
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- A group running of officials from ministries and national institutions took place on Sunday, the first sports day of the year in the DPRK.
					 Those officials gathered at Kim Il Sung Square with the zeal to hasten the advance for a great surge in building a thriving nation in good health by making sports popular and an inseparable part of daily life. And they ran through Sungri Street and Mansudae Street, divided into two groups.
					
					 Among them were officials from the Ministry of Light Industry, Ministry of Coal Industry, Ministry of Electric Power Industry, Ministry of Metal Industry, Ministry of Agriculture, Unha Guidance Bureau and the Mining Machine Industry Guidance Bureau. Running through the streets, they hardened their will to fulfill their responsibility in this year's general offensive and thus contribute to implementing the strategy of the Workers' Party of Korea for the improvement of people's living standard.
					
					 Their high spirit stirred up the atmosphere of the capital city alive with the onward march for improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 "Good health is needed above all to bring good results in work," said Kim Mun Chang (53), vice-minister of Coal Industry. 
					
					 "We government employees generally working in office should take active part in popularization of sports, which will improve our health and bring good results in our work," he told a reporter.
					
					 Similar sport events were held in provinces, cities and counties of the country on the same day with attendance of officials, working people and school youth and children.

articles.title: Peace on Korean Peninsula Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Peace on Korean Peninsula Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- The Joint Conference of Civic and Social Organizations in south Korea held a meeting in Seoul on Jan. 4 to call on the people from all walks of life to work hard for peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					 The greatest victim of escalated tension and armed conflicts between the south and the north is just the entire Korean nation, it said, urging the present "government" to stop getting on the nerves of the north and keying up the military tension.
					
					 The "government" should promptly take substantial measures for defusing the tension in the West Sea of Korea through dialogue and normalize the relations with the north at an early date, it held.
					
					 Meanwhile former and incumbent professors affiliated to the Union of Professors, the Council of Professors for Democracy, the Council of Scientific Organization and other organizations released a joint declaration on Jan. 5. The declaration demanded that the authorities halt the reckless scheme to stifle the north and strive for the improved north-south relations in the main spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: China-resident Koreans to Celebrate Birthday of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
China-resident Koreans to Celebrate Birthday of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China formed a preparatory committee on Jan. 3 to celebrate February 16, the birthday of Genearal Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The committee decided to hold a meeting, Kimjongilia show, book and photo exhibition, art performance and other celebration events.

articles.title: DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Issued Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Issued Abroad
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi and Brazilian organizations carried the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK in their bulletins on January 3.
					 The bulletin of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee said that the army and people of the DPRK have written a heroic epic of victory after victory under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il. They are full of ambition for a brighter future and confidence in sure victory, it added.
					
					 We warmly welcome and fully support the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK, the bulletin said, carrying the full text of the editorial.
					
					 The bulletin of the Brazil-Korea Friendship Association gave an excerpt from the editorial under the title of "Joint editorial of the DPRK sets forth tasks and ways for this year".

articles.title: DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Supported Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Supported Abroad
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations and personages of different countries released statements in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.
					They included the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and officials of friendly organizations in Finland and Sweden.
					
					 In their joint statement on January 3 the Bangladeshi parties called on the political parties and organizations of all countries to fully support the Korean people in the efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The organizations of the Czech Republic in their joint statement on January 4 referred to the brilliant successes gained by the DPRK in politics, economy, culture, science and technology and other fields under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il last year. And they expressed firm belief that the Korean people would successfully carry out the tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial.
					
					 The chairman of the Finland-Korea Society in a statement on January 3 expressed full support for the unshakable stand of the DPRK to achieve peace in Northeast Asia, denuclearize the Korean Peninsula and reunify the country in a peaceful way.
					
					 The successes made by the DPRK last year are a brilliant result of the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il who led the Korean people in the drive for a great surge with his ceaseless field guidance, standing in the van of the drive, said the chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association in a statement on Jan. 3.
